intro: Eriolaena sterculiacea, commonly known as the African mahogany, is a tropical tree native to regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its dense, dark wood that is highly valued for its strength and durability. The plant has simple, opposite leaves and produces small, white flowers that are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in lowland forests and savanna woodlands. Due to its economic importance, it is also subject to conservation concerns in its native habitats.
